p: dsRNA-mediated gene silencing was used to investigate the role of Ae. aegypti HPX8C during DENV infection. The dsRNAs were synthesized using cDNA templates possessing T7 RNA polymerase promoter sequences on both ends ( S3 Table), according to the protocol of T7 RiboMAX Express RNAi system kit (Promega). Micro-injection of dsRNA was performed as described previously [ 40]. Female mosquitoes were cold anaesthetized on the Echotherm chilling/heating dry bath (Torrey scientific). A Nanoliter 2000 injector (World Precision Instrument) was used to introduce 0.67 Î¼g per 200 nl dsRNA into the thorax of female mosquitoes 1 day post eclosion [ 17]. Experiments were conducted under the same conditions and in triplicate. qPCR was performed to confirm the efficiency of gene silencing.
